member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.ISPConversionProcessor
member.summary: Provides methods for custom handling of transformed data, including preprocessing and postprocessing of data returned by the launcher.

member.summary: Provides customization of file content after it has been sent to the document converter.
member.param: An object that conveys the context of the conversion.

A Boolean value that specifies whether the conversion framework will continue processing, i.e., whether to save the resulting Byte array in a file. If not, it is assumed that the PostProcess method has consumed the contents of the Byte array.
A object that contains return code from the converter as well as converted files in the form of byte arrays.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.ISPConversionProcessor.PreProcess(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPExecutingConversionRequest,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Provides customization of file content before it is sent to the document converter.
member.returns: A Byte array that contains the file content.
member.param: An object that conveys the context of the conversion.
A Byte array that contains the contents of the file that is about to be converted. The PreProcess method can be used to customize the file content before it is sent to the converter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult
member.summary: An enumeration which returns the result of the file submission operation against a site object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.FileCheckedOut
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was rejected because the file was not checked in to Windows SharePoint Services. Only a checked-in version can be submitted to the record center.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.FileRejected
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was rejected due to exceeding the filesize limit of 50 megabytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.InvalidConfiguration
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was rejected due to an unknown exception error which occurred during submission. Problem could be caused by network failure, soap exceptions or unavailability of the target record center site

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.MoreInformation
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was partially successful. File was missing some metadata required to route the file to the correct list in the target record center site. In this case, the file is held in a special list in the target, until the missing metadata is provided by the submitter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.NotFound
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was cancelled because the target record center site could not be found. Commonly happens when the submitter did not have rights to submit the file to the target record center. Ensure that the pool account of the application submitter is added to the "Records Center Web Service Submitters" group on the target site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.Success
member.summary: Indicates that a file submission operation was successful.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.OfficialFileResult.UnknownError
member.summary: Indicates that an unknown error caused a file submission operation to fail, possibly due to undetermined network errors, or a failure on the client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions
member.summary: An enumerated list of options that are used to control settings that relate to default content types and content type views.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddFieldCheckDisplayName
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 32. Used to confirm that no other field has the same display name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddFieldInternalNameHint
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 8. Used to add an internal field name hint for the purpose of avoiding possible database locking or field renaming operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddFieldToDefaultView
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 16. Used to specify whether a new field that is added to the specified list must also be added to the default list view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddToAllContentTypes
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 4. Used to specify whether a new field that is added to the specified list must also be added to all content types in the site collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddToDefaultContentType
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 1. Used to specify whether a new field that is added to the list must also be added to the default content type in the site collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.AddToNoContentType
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 2. Used to specify whether a new field must not be added to any other content type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAddFieldOptions.Default
member.summary: Set to a constant decimal value of 0. Used to specify whether a new field must not be added to any other content type. (Same as .)

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert
member.summary: Represents an alert, which generates periodic e-mail notifications sent to a user about the list, list item, document, or document library to which the alert applies. SPAlert provides information about the alert, such as which alert template is used, the alert frequency, and the UserID of the user who created the alert.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Update(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the SharePoint database with changes made to the alert and optionally sends a confirmation e-mail message.
member.param: true to send confirmation e-mail; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the time interval for sending the alert.
member.returns: An value that specifies the time interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the alert template of which the alert is an instance.
member.returns: An object that represents the alert template. This property contains null if the alert is a custom alert without a defined template.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time for sending the alert.
member.returns: A System.DateTime structure that specifies the date and time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of object to which the alert applies, which can be a list or document library, a list item or document, or a custom object.
member.returns: An value that specifies the type of item to which the alert applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlwaysNotify
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that causes daily and weekly alerts to always trigger, even if there is no matching event.
member.returns: Set the return value to true to cause the alert to always trigger; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.DynamicRecipient
member.summary: Gets or sets the string in Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML) that defines the event data to use to populate the e-mail recipient field in the alert.
member.returns: A CAML string that contains the event data for the e-mail recipient field; for example, <FieldRef Name = "assignedto/New">, where /New is optional.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of event to which the alert applies.
member.returns: An value that specifies the types of events applicable to a list, document library, list item, or document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.EventTypeBitmask
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of event to which the alert applies as a bitmask.
member.returns: An integer that specifies the bitmask.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the syntax query in Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML) for a filter to apply to the alert.
member.returns: A CAML string that contains the syntax query.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the GUID that identifies the alert.
member.returns: A string that contains the GUID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the list item or document to which the alert applies.
member.returns: An object that represents the list item or document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.ItemID
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer that identifies the list item or document to which an alert applies in the parent collection of list items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.List

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.ListID
member.summary: Gets or sets the GUID of the list or document library to which the alert applies.
member.returns: A GUID that identifies the list or document library.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.ListUrl

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.MatchId

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Properties

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Title

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions.ManageWeb
member.summary: Grant the ability to perform all administration tasks for the Web site as well as manage content. Activate, deactivate, or edit properties of Web site scoped Features through the object model or through the user interface (UI). When granted on the root Web site of a site collection, activate, deactivate, or edit properties of site collection scoped Features through the object model. To browse to the Site Collection Features page and activate or deactivate site collection scoped Features through the UI, you must be a site collection administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions.Open
member.summary: Allow users to open a Web site, list, or folder to access items inside that container.

member.summary: Update Web Parts to display personalized information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions.UseClientIntegration
member.summary: Use features that launch client applications; otherwise, users must work on documents locally and upload changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions.UseRemoteAPIs
member.summary: Use SOAP, WebDAV, or Microsoft Office SharePoint Designer 2007 interfaces to access the Web site.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBuiltInFieldId
member.summary: A class that retrieves the values of preset (or noncustom) document fields, which in turn are obtained from Windows SharePoint Services Web page documents that have been checked into the document library. Many document types such as e-mail messages, e-mail contacts, workflow events, and other objects can be represented by these fields.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle
member.summary: Represents a day, week, or month view style for a calendar.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.CompareTo(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle)
member.summary: Compares the calendar view style with another calendar view style.
member.param: An object that represents the other calendar view style with which to compare this calendar view style.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.AccessKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut to activate or place focus on the Day, Week, or Month view link in the calendar user interface.
member.returns:
A string that specifies the keyboard shortcut for a view link in the calendar view style. The default values are period (".") for day, hyphen ("-") for week, and equal sign ("=") for month. Press the following key combinations to implement these shortcuts in the user interface:
ALT + .
ALT + -
ALT + =

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the view style is the default view style that is displayed for the calendar.
member.returns: true if the calendar view style is the default view style; otherwise, false. The default value is false for day and week view styles, but true for the month view style.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.ImageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of the image that is associated with the Day, Week, or Month view link in the calendar user interface.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that specifies the height of the image in pixels. The default value is 15.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.ImageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the image that is associated with the Day, Week, or Month view link in the calendar user interface.
member.returns: A string that contains the name of the image file. The default values are day.gif, week.gif, and month.gif.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.ImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels of the image that is associated with the Day, Week, or View link in the calendar user interface.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that specifies the height of the image in pixels. The default value is 16.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.Sequence
member.summary: Gets the order of the calendar view style link as it is displayed above the calendar.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the sequence. The default values are 1 for day, 2 for week, and 3 for month.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.Template
member.summary: Gets the name of the template that defines the view style.
member.returns: A string that contains the name of the template that defines the view style. The default values are CalendarViewdayChrome, CalendarViewweekChrome, and CalendarViewmonthChrome.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.Title
member.summary: Gets the name of the view style that is displayed in the calendar user interface.
member.returns: A string that contains the display name of the calendar view style. The default values are Day, Week, and Month.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyle.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the calendar view style.
member.returns: A string that indicates the type of calendar view style. The default values are day, week, and month.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCalendarViewStyleCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

An object that represents the view with which the view styles are associated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange
member.summary: Represents a change that has been made to objects or metadata within an item, list, Web site, or site collection scope, or a security policy change at the Web application scope that has been recorded in the Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services change log.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.ChangeToken
member.summary: Gets the unique change token of the object that has changed.
member.returns: An object that represents the change token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.ChangeType
member.summary: Gets the type of change that has been made to the item.
member.returns:
An value that indicates the type of change, including adding, updating, deleting, or renaming changes, but also moving items away from or into lists and folders. The value Rename applies to a change in the object’s URL at the leaf node. The values MovedAway and MovedInto apply to a change in one of the branch nodes of the URL. In order to correctly record moves, the change log records the following:
Moving from or to a folder:
MovedAway event on the source list.
MovedInto event on the destination list.
Moving from or to a site:
MovedAway event on the source Web site.
MovedInto event on the destination site.
At the and scopes, only the MovedAway event is recorded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.SiteId
member.summary: Gets the site ID of the site collection in which the object changed.
member.returns: A GUID that represents the site ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.Time

member.returns: A DateTime structure that indicates when the change was committed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of change to return through a query against the change log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Add
member.summary: An item is added within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.AssignmentAdd
member.summary: A user is given permissions to a list with unique permissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.AssignmentDelete
member.summary: Permissions are removed for a user in a list with unique permissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Delete
member.summary: An item is deleted within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MemberAdd
member.summary: A user is added to a group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MemberDelete
member.summary: A user is removed from a group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MoveAway
member.summary: Involves the renaming of a non-leaf section within a URL. The item was moved away from the location within the Web site specified by the change. The log will contain either a MoveAway or a MoveInto value for any given change, but not both. If possible, the change is represented as MoveInto.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MoveInto
member.summary: Involves the renaming of a non-leaf section within a URL. The item was moved into the location within the Web site specified by the change. The log will contain either a MoveAway or a MoveInto value for any given change, but not both. If possible, the change is represented as MoveInto.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Navigation
member.summary: A change in navigation is made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Rename
member.summary: The leaf in a URL is renamed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Restore
member.summary: An object is restored from a backup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleAdd
member.summary: A role definition is added.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleDelete
member.summary: A role definition is deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleUpdate
member.summary: A role definition is updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.SystemUpdate
member.summary: Changes are made that are global within the scope of the change collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Update
member.summary: An item is modified within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestinationCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestinationCollection.Add(System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestinationType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a copy destination that is represented by the specified URL, destination type, and comment to the collection of copy destination objects.
member.param: A string that specifies a comment associated with the copy destination.

An value that indicates the copy behavior associated with the copy destination: "Ignore", "None", "No Update", or "Update". "Update" displays an update prompt on pages that display copy destinations with the update option checked. "No Update" displays the update prompt with the update option unchecked. "Ignore" does not display the update prompt." "None" does not set a type.
A string that specifies the URL of the copy destination.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestinationCollection.CopyTo(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestination[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the copy destination collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index.
member.param: A 32-bit integer that specifies the index at which copying begins.
A zero-based array of objects that is the destination of the elements copied from .

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPCopyDestinationType.Update

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the class to access the data-retrieval service settings for a Web application instead. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the SPDataRetrievalServucesSettings class represented the data-retrieval service settings that are used on a virtual server.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.DataSourceControlEnabled
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to specify whether to enable data source controls so that query requests can be processed. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the DataSourceControlEnabled property returned a Boolean value that indicated whether data source controls are enabled in the Windows SharePoint Services deployment, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: true if data source controls are enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.EnabledOleDbProviders
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to get the list of OLEDB providers that are used in the Web application. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the EnabledOleDbProviders property returned the names of OLE DB providers that are enabled in the Windows SharePoint Services deployment, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: A string array that contains the list of OLE DB providers that are enabled, which includes DB2OLEDB, IBMDADB2, MSDAORA, OraOLEDB.Oracle, and SQLOLEDB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.MaxResponseSize
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to specify the maximum size of the SOAP response that the data source returns to the data-retrieval service. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the MaxResponseSize property returned the maximum size in kilobytes for responses that are returned from the data retrieval service adapter that is used in the Windows SharePoint Services deployment, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of kilobytes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to specify the time in seconds before the data-retrieval service times out if the data source does not respond. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the RequestTimeout property returned the number of seconds that transpire before requests that are made to the data source time out, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.ServicesEnabled
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to specify whether to enable data-retrieval services to process query requests. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the ServicesEnabled property returned a Boolean value that indicated whether data retrieval services are enabled in the Windows SharePoint Services deployment, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: true if data retrieval services are enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.UpdateAllowed
member.summary: Obsolete. Use the property of the class to specify whether to enable update query support. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the UpdateAllowed property returned a Boolean value that indicated whether a data retrieval service adapter can run queries that update the database, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.returns: true if all data retrieval service adapters can be updated; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDateTimeFieldFormatType
member.summary: Specifies the format to use in displaying date and time fields.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDateTimeFieldFormatType.DateOnly
member.summary: Only the date is displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDateTimeFieldFormatType.DateTime
member.summary: Both the date and the time are displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the currency symbol that is used to format the field's value, and also the position of the currency symbol (for example, whether before or after numeric values).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldLinkCollection.Add(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldLink)
member.summary: Adds an object to the collection.
member.param: An object to add to the collection. The argument should not be null.
member.exception: The value of the property of the object you are adding duplicates the value of the Name property for an object already in the collection; or the SPFieldLink object references a field that is out of scope for this content type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldLinkCollection.Delete(System.Guid)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified ID from the collection.
member.param: A System.GuidT:System.Guid object that specifies the ID of the SPFieldLink object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldLinkCollection.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified name from the collection.
member.param: A string containing the name of the SPFieldLink object to delete. The name can be either the internal name (the value of the property) or the display name (the value of the property). Passing the internal name tends to give more reliable results, for two reasons. First, no two objects in the collection can have the same internal name, but it is possible for two or more objects to have the same display name. Second, the Name property is read-only and therefore its value is immutable, whereas the DisplayName property can be modified by users with sufficient rights.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldRatingScaleValue.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that contains the questions and answers of a user in a single survey response.
member.returns:
A string that contains the questions and responses of a single user in the following format, which assumes that the rating scale has three subordinate questions, and that the user has selected 3 as the rating for all three questions:
My First Question;#3#My Second Question;#3#My Third Question;#3#

member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of questions that have been answered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldRatingScaleValue.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the subordinate question and response of a user at the specified index in the collection of subordinate questions of the rating scale.
member.returns: A string that contains the question and response in the following format, which assumes that 2 has been specified as the index and that the user has given 4 as the response: My Third Question;#4
member.param: A 32-bit integer that specifies the index in the collection of subordinate questions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType
member.summary: Specifies a field type for a field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.AllDayEvent
member.summary: Specifies an all day event. Corresponds to the class and to the AllDayEvent field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 29.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Attachments
member.summary: Specifies attachments. Corresponds to the class and to the Attachments field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 19.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Boolean
member.summary: Specifies Boolean values that are stored in the database as 1 or 0. Corresponds to the class and to the Boolean field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 8.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies calculated values. Corresponds to the class and to the Calculated field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 17.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Choice
member.summary: Specifies a predetermined set of values that can be used to enter data into the field. Corresponds to the class and to the Choice field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 6.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Computed
member.summary: Specifies an abstract field type that depends on other fields for its content and definition. Corresponds to the class and to the Computed field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 12.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.ContentTypeId
member.summary: Specifies a content type ID. Corresponds to the ContentTypeId field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 25.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Counter
member.summary: Specifies an integer used for internal ID fields. Corresponds to the Counter field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.CrossProjectLink
member.summary: Specifies a link between projects in a Meetings Workspace site. Corresponds to the class and to the CrossProjectLink field type that is specified on the Field element. Value = 22.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldType.Currency

member.param: A string that contains the comment.

member.summary: Checks in the file to a document library with the specified comment.
member.param: A string that contains a comment about the check in.

member.summary: Checks in the file to a document library based on the specified comment and type of check in to perform.
member.param: A string that contains a comment about the check in.
An value that specifies the type of check in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFile.CheckOut
member.summary: Checks the file out of a document library.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFile.CheckOut(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Checks out the file from a document library based on a Boolean value that indicates whether to check the file out to the local computer, and that indicates the last date that the file was modified.
member.param: true to check the file out locally; otherwise, false.
A string that contains a date. If specified, you can only check out the file if the date on which the file was last modified matches the date that is specified by this parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFile.Convert(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Transforms the file using the specified transformer.
member.returns: An value that indicates the conversion status.
member.param: A string that contains the configuration information that is passed to the transform application when thistransform is requested. The information is specific to the transformapplication and can be an empty string or null.
A System.Guid object that identifies the specific document transformer to use to transform the document.
An out parameter that gets the ID of thework item for this asynchronous request, or that gets Guid.Empty in the case of a synchronous request.

Optional. A string that specifies an assembly to load. Together with the handlerClass parameter, you can specify a pre-conversion or post-conversion handler to invoke before or after the conversion to do different tasks with the converted content, rather than just have the conversion framework make it into a file. The value of this parameter can be null.

The priority of this transform. A lowerpriority means this transform will be processed faster. Transforms that are initiated through the user interface have a priority of 1. Bulk operations that are performed through custom script should have a lower priority.
true to run the conversion synchronously; otherwise, false.
A string that contains the leaf name of the file to be created. The extension is automatically appended by the transformer.
true to attach a copy of the transformed document to the notification; otherwise, false.
A semi-colon-delimited list of e-mail addresses of people to whom to send an alert when the transform is completed. If the string is empty or null, no alert is sent.

Optional. A string that specifies a class to instantiate that is defined in the assembly specified by the handlerAssembly parameter. The class must implement the interface and its methods. Together with the handlerAssembly parameter, you can specify a pre-conversion or post-conversion handler to invoke before or after the conversion to do different tasks with the converted content, rather than just have the conversion framework make it into a file. The value of this parameter can be null.

member.param: A string that specifies the destination URL.

member.summary: Copies the file to the destination URL but overwrites an existing file of the same name only if bOverwrite is true.
member.param: A string that specifies the destination URL.
true to overwrite a file of the same name; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.
member.param: Byte offset in array at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPList.CheckPermissions(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions)
member.summary: Checks the permissions for the list and throws UnauthorizedAccessException if the current user does not have the specified set of rights.
member.param: An value that specifies permissions for the list. See also . If the permission of the current user on the current list object does not include all the bits that are specified in the permissionMask parameter, UnauthorizedAccessException is thrown. When the code is running within a Web application, the user may be redirected to /_layouts/AccessDenied.aspx.

104 — Microsoft Office PowerPoint presentation
105 — Basic page
106 — Web Part page
130 — Data connection
1000 — Blank form

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItemCollection.Add(System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFileSystemObjectType)
member.summary: Creates an item that uses the specified folder URL and object type but requires the method to actually add the item to the list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItemCollection.Add(System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFileSystemObjectType,System.String)

member.returns: An object that represents the new item.
member.param: A string that contains the leaf name, which is everything after the last forward slash in the URL, including the file extension.
An value that indicates the object type. Only File and Folder are valid types for the underlying object type.
A string that contains the server-relative URL of the folder, beginning with a forward slash; for example, /sites/mysite/subweb/Lists/mylist/myfolder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListTemplate
member.summary: Represents a list definition or a list template, which defines the fields and views for a list. List definitions are contained in files within \\Program Files\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Web Server Extensions\12\TEMPLATE\FEATURES, but list templates are created through the user interface or through the object model when a list is saved as a template.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListTemplate.AllowsFolderCreation

member.returns: true if folders can be created; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup
member.summary: Represents the permissions available for role definitions on a Web site. This enumeration is obsolete. Use the enumeration instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Administrator
member.summary: Has full control of the Web site, including the ability to manage role definitions and groups and to view usage data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.All
member.summary: Has all permissions on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader permissions, as well as permissions to add and edit items, manage personal groups and views, and personalize Web Parts Pages. Cannot create lists or document libraries, but can add content to existing ones.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Guest
member.summary: Has limited permissions to view specific pages and page elements. Has access to a specific list but not to the entire site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.None
member.summary: Has no permissions on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Reader
member.summary: Has read-only access to the Web site and cannot add content. Has permissions to view items, personalize Web Parts, use alerts, and create a Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.ValidPermissions
member.summary: Has valid permissions for the site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor permissions, plus permissions to cancel check-out, delete items, manage lists, and add and customize pages. Can modify the structure of the site and create lists or document libraries.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64
member.summary: Represents the permissions available for role definitions on a Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Administrator
member.summary: Has full control of the Web site, including the ability to manage groups and to view usage data. Includes the FullMask base permission (see ).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.All
member.summary: Has all permissions on the Web site. Includes the base permissions of Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader permissions, as well as permissions to add and edit items, manage personal groups and views, and personalize Web Parts Pages. Cannot create lists or document libraries, but can add content to existing ones. In addition to the base permissions of Reader, includes the following base permissions (see ): BrowseDirectories, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts, AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, EditListItems, DeleteListItems, DeleteVersions, EditMyUserInfo.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Guest
member.summary: Has limited permissions to view specific pages and page elements. Has access to a specific list but not to the entire site. Includes the following base permissions (see ): Open, BrowseUserInfo, ViewFormPages, UseClientIntegration, UseRemoteAPIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.None
member.summary: Has no permissions on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Reader
member.summary: Has read-only access to the Web site and cannot add content. Has permissions to view items, personalize Web Parts, use alerts, and create a Web site. In addition to the base permissions of Guest, includes the following base permissions (see ): ViewPages, ViewListItems, OpenItems, ViewVersions, CreateAlerts, CreateSSCSite.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.ValidPermissions
member.summary: Has valid permissions for the site. Includes the following base permissions (see ): ViewListItems, ViewFormPages,AddListItems, EditListItems, DeleteListItems, ApproveItems, CancelCheckout, ManagePersonalViews, ManageLists, Open, ViewPages, AddAndCustomizePages, ApplyThemeAndBorder, ApplyStyleSheets, ViewUsageData, CreateSSCSite, ManageSubwebs, CreateGroups, ManagePermissions, BrowseDirectories, BrowseUserInfo, AddDelPrivateWebParts, UpdatePersonalWebParts, ManageWeb, UseRemoteAPIs, EditMyUserInfo, EnumeratePermissions, OpenItems, ViewVersions, DeleteVersions, ManageAlerts, CreateAlerts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor permissions, plus permissions to cancel check-out, delete items, manage lists, and add and customize pages. Can modify the structure of the site and create lists or document libraries. In addition to the base permissions of Contributor, includes the following base permissions (see ): AddAndCustomizePages, ManageLists, ApproveItems, ApplyThemeAndBorder, ApplyStyleSheets, CancelCheckout.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRecycleBinItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the Recycle Bin for a Web site or a site collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRecycleBinItem.System.IComparable.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current Recycle Bin item with another item.
member.returns:
A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings:
Value
Meaning
Less than zero
The Recycle Bin item is a list item, but not the object with which it is being compared. Otherwise, if both objects are list items, the Recycle Bin item alphabetically or numerically precedes the specified object according to directory, or title, if the items are located in the same directory, or item ID, if their titles are identical.
Zero
The Recycle Bin item is equal to the specified object.
Greater than zero
The Recycle Bin item is not a list item, but the object with which it is being compared is a list item. Otherwise, if both objects are list items, the Recycle Bin item alphabetically or numerically follows the specified object according to directory, or title, if the items are located in the same directory, or item ID, if their titles are identical.
member.param: An object to compare with this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.EmptyMask

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.FullMask
member.summary: Value: -1. Has all permissions on the Web site. Not available through the user interface. Groups: N/A.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleDefinition.Xml
member.summary: Gets the permissions for the role definition in XML format.
member.returns:
A string that contains the permissions in XML format. For example, the XML property returns the following role definition for the Contribute permission level:
<Role ID="1073741827" Name="Contribute" Description="Can view, add, update, and delete." Order="0" Hidden="False" Type="Contributor" BasePermissions="ViewListItems, AddListItems, EditListItems, DeleteListItems, OpenItems, ViewVersions, DeleteVersions, ManagePersonalViews, ViewFormPages, Open, ViewPages, CreateSSCSite, BrowseDirectories, BrowseUserInfo, AddDelPrivateWebParts, UpdatePersonalWebParts, UseClientIntegration, UseRemoteAPIs, CreateAlerts, EditMyUserInfo" />

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType
member.summary: Specifies the types of roles that are available for users and groups.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Administrator
member.summary: Has all rights from other roles, plus rights to manage roles and view usage analysis data. Includes all rights in the WebDesigner role, plus the following: ManageListPermissions, ManageRoles, ManageSubwebs, ViewUsageData. The Administrator role cannot be customized or deleted, and must always contain at least one member. Members of the Administrator role always have access to, or can grant themselves access to, any item in the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader rights, plus rights to add items, edit items, delete items, manage list permissions, manage personal views, personalize Web Part Pages, and browse directories. Inclues all rights in the Reader role, plus the following: AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, BrowseDirectories, CreatePersonalGroups, DeleteListItems, EditListItems, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts. Contributors cannot create new lists or document libraries, but they can add content to existing lists and document libraries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Guest
member.summary: Has limited rights to view pages and specific page elements. This role is used to give users access to a particular page, list, or item in a list, without granting rights to view the entire site. Users cannot be added explicitly to the Guest role; users who are given access to lists or document libraries by way of per-list permissions are added automatically to the Guest role. The Guest role cannot be customized or deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.None
member.summary: Has no rights on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Reader
member.summary: Has rights to view items, personalize Web parts, use alerts, and create a top-level Web site using Self-Service Site Creation. A reader can only read a site; he or she cannot add content. When a reader creates a site using Self-Service Site Creation, he or she becomes the site owner and a member of the Administrator role for the new site. This does not affect the user's role membership for any other site. Rights included: CreateSSCSite, ViewListItems, ViewPages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor rights, plus rights to cancel check out, delete items, manage lists, add and customize pages, define and apply themes and borders, and link style sheets. Includes all rights in the Contributor role, plus the following: AddAndCustomizePages, ApplyStyleSheets, ApplyThemeAndBorder, CancelCheckout, ManageLists.WebDesigners can modify the structure of the site and create new lists or document libraries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite.SyndicationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether RSS syndication is enabled for the site collection.
member.returns: true to enable syndication; otherwise, false. Setting this property to true has no effect if syndication is blocked at a higher level. If the property of the parent Web application is set to true, setting this property to true means that the site collection supports RSS feeds, and it also means that the property returns true. If the property of the parent Web application is set to false, setting this property to true has no effect on the property and does not enable RSS feeds in the site collection.

A System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection object that contains the internal names of the view fields.

A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the maximum number of items to return in the view. Specifying a value greater than Int32.MaxValue (2,147,483,647 or hexadecimal 0x7FFFFFFF) throws an exception because the value is out of range.
true to make the view the default view; otherwise, false.
true to specify that the view supports displaying more items page by page; otherwise, false.

member.param: An value that specifies the view type.
A string that contains the name of the view.

true to create a personal view; false to create a public view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb.CheckPermissions(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions)
member.summary: Checks the permissions for the Web site and raises an Access Denied error if the permissions fail.
member.param: An value that specifies permissions for the list. See also . If the permission of the current user of the current Web site object does not include all the bits that are specified in the permissionMask parameter, an UnauthorizedAccessException error is raised. When the code is running within a Web application, the user may be redirected to /_layouts/AccessDenied.aspx.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb.GetSiteData(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSiteDataQuery)
member.summary: Performs a query for list items across multiple lists, which can be located in multiple Web sites in the same Web site collection.
member.returns: A System.Data.DataTable object that represents the result of the query. Each DataRow object in the DataTable.Rows collection represents a single item that satisfies the query. Each DataColumn object in the DataTable.Columns collection represents a field that is requested in the query fields, and the column name of the field equals the value of the Name attribute for that field. In addition, DataTable.Columns contains a DataColumn named ListId, which identifies the list that contains each item, a DataColumn named WebId, which identifies the Web site that contains each item, and a DataColumn named ID, which identifies each item.
member.param: An object that describes the query to perform, as well as specifying which Web sites and lists participate, what fields to return, and the Where and OrderBy sections to apply.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Web site object with the specified Web site-relative URL.
member.returns: An object that represents the Web site.
member.param: A string that contains the new Web site URL relative to the root Web site in the site collection. For example, to create a Web site at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/MyNewWebsite, specify MyNewWebsite, or to create a Web site one level lower at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/Website/MyNewWebsite, specify Website/MyNewWebsite.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebTemplate,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a Web site object with the specified site-relative URL, title, description, locale ID, and site definition or site template object.
member.returns: An object that represents the Web site.
member.param: A string that contains the new Web site URL relative to the root Web site in the site collection. For example, to create a Web site at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/MyNewWebsite, specify MyNewWebsite, or to create a Web site one level lower at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/Website/MyNewWebsite, specify Website/MyNewWebsite.
true to convert an existing folder of the same name to a SharePoint site. false to throw an exception that indicates that a URL path with the specified site name already exists.
An object that represents the site definition or site template.
A string that contains the description.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that specifies the locale ID.
true to create a subsite that does not inherit permissions from another site; otherwise, false.
A string that contains the title.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a Web site object with the specified site-relative URL, title, description, locale ID, and site definition or site template name.
member.returns: An object that represents the new Web site.
member.param: A string that contains the new Web site URL relative to the root Web site in the site collection. For example, to create a Web site at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/MyNewWebsite, specify MyNewWebsite, or to create a Web site one level lower at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/Website/MyNewWebsite, specify Website/MyNewWebsite.
true to convert an existing folder of the same name to a SharePoint site. false to throw an exception that indicates that a URL path with the specified site name already exists.
A string that contains the description.
A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the locale ID.
true to create a subsite that does not inherit permissions from another site; otherwise, false .
A string that contains the title.

A string that contains the name of the site definition configuration or site template. The following table shows the values for the default site definition configurations that are included in an installation of Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.
Value
Site Definition
STS#0
Team Site
STS#1
Blank Site
STS#2
Document Workspace
MPS#0
Basic Meeting Workspace
MPS#1
Blank Meeting Workspace
MPS#2
Decision Meeting Workspace
MPS#3
Social Meeting Workspace
MPS#4
Multipage Meeting Workspace
WIKI#0
Wiki
BLOG#0
Blog
By default, a global site template (GLOBAL#0) is added to all site definitions. You cannot explicitly create a site based on a global site template.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the Web site object with the specified Web site-relative URL from the collection.
member.param: A string that contains the Web site URL relative to the root Web site in the site collection. For example, if the Web site to delete is located at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/DeleteSubsite, specify DeleteSubsite, or if it is located at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/Subsite/DeleteSubsite, specify Subsite/DeleteSubsite.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWebCollection.Count

member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of Web sites.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.AddBackupObjects(Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.SPBackupRestoreObject)
member.summary: Adds the database and its children to the backup/restore job. This method implements the method that is defined in the interface. The class can be backed up and restored and must therefore implement the interface, but this method is only intended to be callable from catastrophic backup and restore infrastructure code in Windows SharePoint Services.
member.param: An object from the parent of the database object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.ChangeDatabaseInstance(Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabaseServiceInstance)
member.summary: Modifies the specified database service instance for each connection string that is used to access the database.
member.param: An object that represents the database service instance.

member.summary: Creates a connection string that is used in provisioning based on a specified connection string.
member.returns: A System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder object that represents the new connection string.
member.param: A System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder object that represents the original connection string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.GenerateRandomName(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder@)
member.summary: Generates a random database name using the specified connection string as a starting point.
member.param: A System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder object that contains the connection string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.OnAbort(System.Object,Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.SPBackupRestoreInformation)
member.summary: Called when the backup terminates unexpectedly. This method implements the method that is defined in the interface. The class can be backed up and restored and must therefore implement the interface, but this method is only intended to be callable from catastrophic backup and restore infrastructure code in Windows SharePoint Services.
member.returns: true if successful; otherwise, false.
member.param: An object that represents the database that is being backed up.
An object that contains data about the event.

An object that contains data about the event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.Provision(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Boolean})

A string that specifies the file system path of the provisioning script.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.Unprovision

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPDatabase.Update
member.summary: Causes the database to save its state and propagate changes to all the computers in the server farm.

A System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection object that contains the list of OLEDB providers. By default, the following providers are included:
DB2OLEDB
IBMDADB2
MSDAORA
OraOLEDB.Oracle
SQLOLEDB

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPFarm.ObjectChanged
member.summary: Raised after any configuration object in the system that is above the level of a site collection () is changed. This event is raised on all computers in the server farm after the caches have been refreshed, but it is not raised if caching is disabled for the process.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPFarm.ObjectCreated
member.summary: Raised after any configuration object in the system above the level of a site collection () is created. This event is raised on all computers in the server farm after the caches have been refreshed, but it is not raised if caching is disabled for the process.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPFarm.ObjectDeleted
member.summary: Raised after any configuration object in the system above the level of a site collection () is deleted. This event is raised on all computers in the server farm after the caches have been refreshed, but it is not raised if caching is disabled for the process.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPFarm.ObjectsRestored
member.summary: Raised after any configuration object in the system above the level of a site collection () is restored. This event is raised on all computers in the server farm after the caches have been refreshed, but it is not raised if caching is disabled for the process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPGlobalAdmin.AddWPPack(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Use the class and other related solution objects to deploy Web Parts instead. (In Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, the AddWPPack method either enabled a Web Part package that was already installed on the virtual server and added it to the Web Part gallery, or installed and enabled a Web Part package and added it to the Web Part gallery, and is maintained for backward compatibility.)
member.param: A string that contains the URL for the virtual server. The strURL parameter is used in conjunction with the strName or strPathname parameter. If strURL is set to null, the Web Part Package specified by the strName parameter is enabled for all virtual servers on the front-end Web server, or the Web Part package specified by the strPathname parameter is installed on all virtual servers on the front-end Web server.
true to install the Web Part package to each front-end Web server in a server farm; otherwise, false.

A string that contains the file name of the installed Web Part package to enable. If not specified, strPathname must be specified. The strName parameter is used in conjunction with the strURL parameter. If strURL contains null, the Web Part package is enabled for all virtual servers on the front-end Web server; otherwise, the package is enabled for the virtual server specified by strURL.
true to overwrite an existing Web Part package with a new version; otherwise, false.

A string that contains the full file system path for the Web Part package to install. If not specified, strName must be specified. The strPathname parameter is used in conjunction with the strURL parameter. If strURL contains null, the Web Part package is installed on all virtual servers on the front-end Web server; otherwise, the package is installed on the virtual server specified by strURL.
A System.IO.TextWriter object that is used to write an error log to the text stream. This parameter can contain null.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that specifies the locale ID for the Web Part package. This parameter can be 0 or any valid LCID (such as 1033 for English).

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus
member.summary: Specifies the status of a service that runs within a Windows SharePoint Services deployment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies that the components that are necessary to run the service are installed on the computer, but an administrator needs to provision the service and put it online. New sites cannot be created in content databases, even though the databases have not reached their maximum site collection limits. This value corresponds to the Offline value that can be selected through the Database status box on the Manage Content Database Settings page in SharePoint Central Administration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Offline
member.summary: Specifies that the component is offline for some unknown reason. New sites cannot be created in content databases, but old sites can be accessed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Online
member.summary: Specifies that the service is provisioned and running as expected. New sites can be created in content databases up to their maximum site collection limits. This value corresponds to the Ready value that can be selected through the Database status box on the Manage Content Database Settings page in SharePoint Central Administration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Provisioning
member.summary: Specifies that the administrator has issued the command to provision the service and put it online, but the provisioning job has not completed yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Unprovisioning
member.summary: Specifies that the administrator has issued the command to unprovision the service and leave it in a disabled state, but the unprovisioning job has not completed yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPObjectStatus.Upgrading
member.summary: Specifies that the administrator has issued the command to upgrade the service and put it online, but the upgrade job has not completed yet.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType
member.summary: Specifies which part of a URL namespace that is used in this Web application belongs to Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType.Exclusion
member.summary: This enumeration member is obsolete in Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 because it is no longer necessary to tell Windows SharePoint Services which URL paths should not be handled by Windows SharePoint Services. When the IIS worker process that serves the Web application is started, it scans the IIS home directory of the Web application looking for files, folders, and virtual directories. Those that it finds are automatically excluded, and are not listed in the object associated with the Web application. This member generates a compiler warning, no operation is performed, and no exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType.ExplicitInclusion
member.summary: Specifies that a path-based site collection can be created at this specific URL path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType.WildcardInclusion
member.summary: Specifies that multiple path-based site collections can be created under this URL path.

member.summary: Holds modifications that are made to the web.config.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified modification name and node.
member.param: A string that contains the unique name of the modification.

A string that contains an XPath expression that specifies that the node that is being modified. If the web.config modification type () is EnsureChildNode, the xpath attribute specifies the XPath expression for the parent node under which the node is created: for example, "/configuration/SharePoint/SafeControls".

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the attribute or section node that should be set.
member.returns: A string that contains the name of the attribute or section node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner of the web.config modification.
member.returns: A string that specifies the owner of the modification.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the XPath expression that is used to locate the node that is being operated on.
member.returns: A string that contains an XPath expression that specifies the node. If the property specifies EnsureChildNode, the Path property contains the XPath expression for the parent node under which the node is created. For example, the following string specifies the path to specify for safe control entries: "/configuration/SharePoint/SafeControls".

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Sequence
member.summary: Gets or sets the sequence number of the modification.
member.returns: A 32-bit unsigned integer between 0 and 65536. This property throws an InvalidOperationException if the number is outside this range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of modification that is implied by the class.
member.returns: An value that specifies the type of modification.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the item to set.
member.returns: If the property specifies EnsureChildNode, the Value property contains an XML string that represents the node to be populated as a child of the specified parent node. If the type is EnsureSection, Value contains the name of the section. If the type is EnsureAttribute, Value contains the value set in the attribute.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.SPWebConfigModificationType
member.summary: Specifies the type of web.config modification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.SPWebConfigModificationType.EnsureAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the web.config modification must ensure the value of a particular attribute. Value = 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.SPWebConfigModificationType.EnsureChildNode
member.summary: Specifies that the web.config modification must ensure a child node of the node to which the XPath expression points. Value = 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebConfigModification.SPWebConfigModificationType.EnsureSection
member.summary: Ensures a singleton node. This node is only written once, even if multiple entities register multiple instances of EnsureSection to ensure a single section. Value = 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Deployment.SPIncludeSecurity.WssOnly
member.summary: Includes user memberships and role assignments such as out of the box roles like Web Designer, or any custom roles that extend from the out of the box roles. The ACL for each object is migrated. No user information defined in the DAP or LDAP servers is included.

member.name: N:Microsoft.SharePoint.SoapServer
member.summary: Contains classes that implement the Windows SharePoint Services Web Service on the server. In most cases, the members of these classes are not designed to be called from the server, and are not tested in this configuration. The methods provided by a Web service are designed to be called remotely from client applications. For information about using the methods of a Web service implemented by one of these classes, click the appropriate link in the Class column of the following table.

member.summary: A non-syntax error.

member.summary: A syntax error.

member.summary: Adds new command-line operations and new functionality to the STSADM.EXE utility.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.StsAdmin.ISPStsadmCommand.GetHelpMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a remark about the syntax of the specified custom operation.
member.returns: A that represents a description of the syntax of the operation command.
member.param: The operation about which help is sought.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.StsAdmin.ISPStsadmCommand.Run(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary,System.String@)
member.summary: Executes the specified operation.
member.returns:
An that can be used to signal the result of the operation. For proper operation with STSADM, use the following rules when implementing.
Return 0 for success.
Return (-1) for any error other than syntax.
Return (-2) for a syntax error.
When 0 is returned, STSADM streams output, if it is not null, to the console.
When is returned, STSADM calls and its return value is streamed to the console, and it streams output, if it is not null, to stderr (standard error). To obtain the content of stderr in managed code, use .
When any other value is returned, STSADM streams output, if it is not null, to stderr.
member.param: An output string, if needed.
The parameters, if any, that are added to the command line.
The name of the custom operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Utilities.SPUtility.AlternateServerUrlFromHttpRequestUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns the outgoing Universal Resource Locator (URL) for the alternate request URL represented by the specified URI.
member.returns: A System.Uri object that represents the outgoing URL and any additional parts of the URL, such as the path, that together compose the complete incoming URL. For example, if the incoming URL is http://incoming and the outgoing URL is http://outgoing, this method returns http://outgoing. If the incoming URL is http://incoming/sites/mySite/Lists/myList/AllItems.aspx, the returned URI object would represent http://outgoing/sites/mySite/Lists/myList/AllItems.aspx. If no outgoing URL is defined for the zone associated with the incoming URL, or that incoming URL is not included in a collection of alternate URLs, Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services returns the same System.Uri that was passed as parameter to this method.
member.param: A System.Uri object that represents the request URL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.ListProperty.Property
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property to render for the server control.
member.returns:
A string that contains the name of a property listed in the following table.
Name
Value
Created
Date and time the list was created.
DefaultViewUrl
Server-relative URL of the default list view.
Description
Description of the list.
EnableSyndication
true if RSS syndication is enabled for the list; otherwise, false.
ItemCount
Number of items in the list.
LinkTitle
Title linked to list.
MajorVersionLimit
For a document library that uses version control with major versions only, maximum number of major versions allowed for items.
MajorWithMinorVersionsLimit
For a document library that uses version control with both major and minor versions, maximum number of major versions allowed for items.
RelativeFolderPath
Site-relative URL for the list.
Title
Title of the list.
ViewSelector
View selector with links to views for the list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.ProjectProperty.Property
member.summary: Gets or sets the current project property.
member.returns:
A string that contains the name of a project property listed in the following table.
Name
Description
BlogCategoryTitle
Category of the current post item.
BlogPostTitle
Title of the current post item.
Description
Description of the current Web site.
RecycleBinEnabled
1 if the recycle bin is enabled; otherwise, 0.
SiteOwnerName
User name of the owner for the current site collection.
SiteUrl
Full URL of the current site collection.
Title
Title of the current Web site.
Url
Full URL of the current Web site.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.UserField.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the value of the control in the UI.
member.returns:
A (cast to ) that represents the value of the control in the UI, which is not necessarily its value in the Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 database until is called. The has the following form.
User_or_Group_ID;#User_or_Group_Name[;#User_or_Group_ID;#User_or_Group_Name ...]
The User_or_Group_ID is the ID number of the user or group on the site. The User_or_Group_Name is the name of the user or group. An example of this kind of is 145;#BobR;#11;#Sally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.HtmlDesignerAttribute.DialogFeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape, size, or other features of the custom properties builder dialog box.
member.returns:
String Specifies the properties for the custom properties builder dialog box.
The following list details the allowable values for the DialogFeatures property:
Option
Values
Description
dialogHeight
sHeight
Sets the height of the dialog box.
dialogLeft
sXPos
Sets the left position of the dialog box relative to the upper-left corner of the desktop.
dialogTop
sYPos
Sets the top position of the dialog box relative to the upper-left corner of the desktop.
dialogWidth
sWidth
Sets the width of the dialog box.
center
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether to center the dialog box within the desktop. The default is Yes.
dialogHide
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box is hidden when printing or using print preview. This feature is only available when a dialog box is opened from a trusted application. The default is No.
edge
sunken, raised
Specifies the edge style of the dialog box. The default is Raised.
help
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box displays the context-sensitive Help icon. The default is Yes.
resizable
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box has fixed dimensions. The default is No.
scroll
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box displays scrollbars. The default is Yes.
status
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box displays a status bar. The default is Yes for untrusted dialog boxes and No for trusted dialog boxes.
unadorned
yes, no, 1, 0, on, off
Specifies whether the dialog box displays the window border. This feature is only available when a dialog box is opened from a trusted application. The default is No.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.HtmlDesignerAttribute.HtmlEditorBuilderType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of custom HTML property builder.
member.returns: String Specifies the type of builder. Use the to support builders of these types: color, date, file, font, picture, and string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart.GetToolParts
member.summary: Determines which tool parts are displayed in the tool pane of the Web-based Web Part design user interface, and the order in which they are displayed.
member.returns: An array of type that determines which tool parts will be displayed in the tool pane. If a Web Part that implements one or more custom properties does not override the method, the base class method will return an instance of the class and an instance of the class. An instance of the class displays a tool part for working with the properties provided by the WebPart base class. An instance of the class displays a built-in tool part for working custom Web Part properties, as long as the custom property is of one of the types supported by that tool part. The supported types are: String, Boolean, Integer, DateTime, or Enum.

member.summary: Registers an interface from the namespace for a connectable Web Part.
member.param: A brief description of the interface that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.
The label that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.
The type of the interface as listed in the fields of the class.
A valuethat specifies where the interface can be run.
The string used to reference the interface in script for client-side connections, for example RowProviderInterface_WPQ_.
The specified limit on the number of connections to this interface. Can be either or .
A reference to the implemented interface.
The friendly name of the interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart.RegisterInterface(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.ConnectionRunAt,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers an interface from the namespace for a connectable Web Part with the option of specifying how cross-page connections are handled.
member.param: A brief description of the interface that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.
The label that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.

Specifies whether this connection interface is exposed in the user interface of authoring environments for creating a connection across two Web Part pages. If the value is set to true, this connection interface is exposed in the authoring environment for creating cross-page connections within the limitations of the connection compatibility rules defined by the Web Part infrastructure. If the value is set to false, the interface is not available for authoring cross-page connections.
A valuethat specifies where the interface can be run.
The string used to reference the interface in script for client-side connections, for example RowProviderInterface_WPQ_.
The type of the interface as listed in the fields of the class.
The specified limit on the number of connections to this interface. Can be either or .
A reference to the implemented interface.
The friendly name of the interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPartZone
member.summary: Allows you to create zones that are containers for Web Parts. The properties of this class allow you to specify how the zone will appear on your Web Part Page and also the behavior of the zone itself. For example, when you create the zone object, you can allow personalization and/or customization for the Web Parts placed within the zone.

member.name: N:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication
member.summary: Provides a set of interfaces and their supporting classes and members that can be implemented in the class of a custom Web Part to support creating connections with other Web Parts. A Web Part can implement one or more of these interfaces to allow it to receive or pass information to other connected Web Parts on a Web Part Page. A Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication namespace interface is a set of events and event handlers for providing or consuming data from list, row, and cell data contained within a Web Part.

member.summary: Occurs when the parameter list is ready to be sent to the consumer Web Part. On the client computer, it can occur at any time; however, it is typically raised when a parameter is updated or selected. On the server, it must be raised in the PartCommunicationMain method.

A ParametersInConsumerInitEventArgs that provides an array of objects. Each item in the array contains property values for a parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.RowReadyEventArgs.SelectionStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the row selected.
member.returns:
The type of row currently selected. SelectionStatus can have one of the following three case-sensitive values.
Value
Description
New
Indicates that the new or star row is selected in a datasheet view control.
None
Indicates that no row is selected.
Standard
Indicates that a standard row is selected.
